author: DM Editorial
title: Sri Lanka embarks on Society 5.0 Journey: CSSL introduces bold vision at National ITC Conference
text:
Reply To:
Name - Reply Comment
The National Information Technology Conference (NITC) 2024, hosted by the Computer Society of Sri Lanka (CSSL), marked a pivotal moment in Sri Lanka’s digital journey.
Under the theme “Catalyzing a Progressive Future: Towards Society 5.0,” the event introduced the transformative concept of Society 5.0 to the nation —a vision that integrates advanced technologies like Artificial Intelligence (AI), the Internet of Things (IoT), robotics, and Big Data into every facet of society. Originating in Japan, Society 5.0 aims to balance technological progress with social inclusivity and sustainability, providing a pathway for Sri Lanka to overcome its unique challenges while positioning itself as a regional leader in digital innovation.
The conference unfolded at Shangri-La Hotel, Colombo on November 24, 25 and 26, brought together nearly 2000 policymakers, industry leaders, academics, and tech innovators, sparking dialogue on how Sri Lanka could adapt Society 5.0 to foster sustainable economic growth, improve societal well-being, and bridge the urban-rural divide. The CSSL’s initiative highlighted the importance of leveraging technology to create a human-centric society where technology serves the people, addressing national challenges while propelling the country toward a resilient and inclusive future.
Dr. Ajantha Atukorale, President of CSSL, emphasized the significance of this step for Sri Lanka. “As a nation poised for economic recovery and digital transformation, Society 5.0 offers us a roadmap to tackle critical challenges while enhancing the quality of life for every Sri Lankan. By seamlessly integrating technology into society, we can create a future that is not only innovative but also inclusive and sustainable,” he stated during his keynote address. His words set the tone for the conference, highlighting the potential of Society 5.0 to be a transformative force for Sri Lanka’s economic and social landscape.
Sri Lanka is at a crossroads, facing pressing challenges such as regional disparities, workforce concerns stemming from an aging population, the need for post-crisis economic recovery, and the imperative to achieve global competitiveness. Society 5.0, as envisioned at NITC 2024, offers a robust framework to address these challenges. It provides solutions that transcend traditional economic and technological approaches, emphasizing the seamless integration of the cyber and physical worlds to create a smart, sustainable society.
The economic impact of Society 5.0 could be profound. Industries such as manufacturing and agriculturepillars of Sri Lanka’s economystand to benefit significantly from automation, precision farming, and AI-driven analytics. These technologies can optimize production processes, reduce waste, and increase yields, ensuring Sri Lanka’s competitiveness in global markets.
Moreover, the emphasis on digital transformation offers unparalleled opportunities for the country’s thriving MSME (Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises) sector. These enterprises, which form the backbone of Sri Lanka’s economy, could leverage digital tools, cloud platforms, and global e-commerce channels to scale their operations and build resilience against market uncertainties.
Beyond economic growth, Society 5.0 promises to address deeprooted social challenges. Regional disparities, for instance, remain a significant barrier to Sri Lanka’s equitable development. By enhancing Internet connectivity and implementing smart infrastructure, digital transformation can bring essential servicessuch as education, healthcare, and financial servicesto underserved regions. This would not only empower rural communities but also create new economic opportunities across the country.
Another pressing issue is Sri Lanka’s aging population, which poses challenges to its workforce and healthcare systems. Society 5.0 offers innovative solutions, including AI-driven healthcare diagnostics, telemedicine, and robotic assistance, to improve the quality and accessibility of care. Such technologies could ensure that older citizens receive the support they need while alleviating the strain on Sri Lanka’s healthcare infrastructure.
During the conference, CSSL highlighted several critical areas that require immediate attention to successfully transition into a Society 5.0 framework. Chief among these is the need for collaborative policy development. Dr. Atukorale called for joint efforts between the government, private sector, academia, and international stakeholders to establish policies that foster innovation, ethical AI use, and inclusivity. “To realize the potential of Society 5.0, we must create an ecosystem where innovation thrives and technology is accessible to all,” he remarked and suggested recognizing ICT Sector as an Industry by the relevant authorities.
Dr Atukorale also suggested establishing a Chartered Institution to recognize ICT Professionalsas capacity building emerged as another focal point. As technology continues to evolve, equipping Sri Lanka’s workforce with future-ready skills is essential. Initiatives to upskill youth, professionals, and entrepreneurs in digital technologies could ensure a smooth transition and prepare the population for the jobs of tomorrow. These efforts, combined with investments in advanced digital infrastructure such as 5G, IoT networks, and cloud platforms, were identified as vital enablers for Society 5.0.
Sustainability and green technology also featured prominently in the discussions. Society 5.0 aligns closely with Sri Lanka’s commitment to global climate goals. Technologies like smart grids, renewable energy systems, and efficient waste management align with the country’s green initiatives and could play a critical role in reducing environmental impact while supporting sustainable economic growth.
Cybersecurity and ethical technology use were also emphasized as foundational elements of Society 5.0. “As we embrace Society 5.0, cybersecurity and ethical use of technology must be top priorities. It is our responsibility to ensure these technologies are used for the betterment of all citizens while protecting their privacy and data,” stated Udesh I. W. Seneviratna, the conference chair.
He also underscored the importance of fostering public trust in technology, which is critical for the successful adoption of Society 5.0. “As Sri Lanka embarks on a pivotal technological transformation, the theme “Catalyzing a Progressive Future: Towards Society 5.0” resonates deeply with our national aspirations since society 5.0, a visionary concept from Japan, aims to create a human-centered society that harmonizes economic growth with social problem solving through the seamless integration of cyberspace and physical space. For Sri Lanka, this theme represents not just an ideal but a practical road map for overcoming current challenges and fostering sustainable development” he further remarked.
The Ministry of Digital Economy, Deputy Minister Eng. Eranga Udesh Weeraratne, echoed this sentiment. “The government is committed to creating an environment where innovation and technology can thrive. Society 5.0 is not just about adopting technology; it’s about building a smarter, more equitable Sri Lanka. Through public-private partnerships and policy support, we aim to foster an ecosystem that drives economic growth and societal well-being,and for this a dedicated Digital Economic Authority will be formed” he remarked.
The NITC 2024 conference also explored the potential of Society 5.0 to transform Sri Lanka’s tourism sector. As one of the country’s key revenue generators, tourism could benefit significantly from smart technologies. Personalized travel experiences, efficient heritage site management, and eco-tourism initiatives could enhance Sri Lanka’s appeal to global travelers while ensuring sustainable practices.
As the conference concluded, the discussions underscored the importance of collaboration in realizing this ambitious vision. CSSL’s leadership in introducing Society 5.0 positions it as a key player in steering Sri Lanka toward a smarter, more connected future. By fostering innovation, bridging regional disparities, and addressing pressing social challenges, Society 5.0 offers a transformative pathway for Sri Lanka to emerge as a leader in digital innovation and sustainable development.
The NITC 2024 reinforced its role as a platform for groundbreaking ideas and strategic initiatives. The focus on Society 5.0 this year was a call to action for all stakeholders:government, industry, academia, and civil societyto work together in shaping a nation that is ready to embrace the challenges and opportunities of tomorrow.
The vision of Society 5.0 is not merely about technology; it is about reimagining how technology can serve humanity. For Sri Lanka, this is a chance to innovate, rebuild, and thrive in an interconnected and inclusive global community. As CSSL continues to champion this transformation, the future of Sri Lanka as a smart, sustainable society looks brighter than ever.

text:

Vita-Collagen Perfect Glow Cream of BEAUTY ABIDE , a premium skin care brand founded by Korean Beauty Brand Company H.N Global Holdings (Heena Seo, President), is standing out in the Global Market. This cream contains patented material for skin improvement, offers high quality at a reasonable price, and is gaining great popularity both at home and abroad.
In the past, Ms. Seo experienced skin damages to the point where she needed dermatological treatment after using cosmetics that were not suitable for her skin type for a long-term period, so that while thinking about a way to care for skin with regardless of skin type and less irritation, she planned to make the ‘Vita-Collagen Perfect Glow Cream’.
In the past, she experienced skin damages to the point where she needed dermatological treatment after using cosmetics that were not suitable for her skin type for a long-term period, so that while thinking about less irritating skin care method regardless of skin type, she planned to make the ‘Vita-Collagen Perfect Glow Cream’.

title: Enersponse and Hiveon Unite to Improve Energy Management and Sustainability Within the Crypto-Mining Sector - Golf News Today - EIN Presswire
text: Enersponse , a leading distributed energy resource management (DERMs) provider, today announced it has teamed up with Hiveon to offer crypto industry turnkey access to Hiveon Enterprise platform and Enersponse’s automated and fully customizable demand response (DR) programs for a more sustainable, strategic and tailored approach to energy management. As an emerging sector characterized by its power-intensive processes such as cryptographic hashing and blockchain validation, the crypto-mining industry faces significant challenges in managing energy consumption efficiently while maintaining profitability and minimizing impact on the grid. This new partnership provides an automated and seamless solution to this hurdle by integrating Enersponse’s sophisticated DR solutions into Hiveon’s high-performance computing (HPC) management platform—enabling crypto-miners to make more cost-effective energy management decisions while contributing to decarbonization efforts and supporting a more reliable power grid. “With Enersponse’s strong commitment to providing completely customized solutions that meet our customers’ core operational needs without sacrificing performance, integrating our advanced DERMs platform with Hiveon’s leading HPC management solutions was a natural fit,” said James McPhail, chief executive officer of Enersponse. “This synergetic partnership will offer crypto-miners tailored DR solutions that enhance operational efficiency, reduce costs and generate new revenue streams through financial incentives. It also promotes significant energy conservation, making it a highly rewarding venture for our customers and the entire crypto sector.” Hiveon offers a comprehensive suite of solutions designed to enhance operations and maximize profits for enterprise-scale crypto-mining companies by addressing common industry-related complexities such as market fluctuations, hardware instability and human error. By monitoring weather patterns, system outages and energy pricing fluctuations, the integration of Enersponse’s customizable solutions can automatically adjust power utilization in real-time based on pre-set client preferences without the need for human intervention. This offers a simple, convenient and tailored way for Hiveon customers to optimize their energy consumption and easily access utility rebates and other financial incentives—all without compromising the unique requirements of crypto-mining operations. "Our innovative solutions are designed to bridge the gap between financial and operational performance within the crypto sector by emphasizing unparalleled efficiency and future-ready data utilization—a mission that is perfectly aligned with what Enersponse brings to the table,” added James Jewell, chief executive officer at Hiveon Enterprise. "Integrating Enersponse's advanced DR solutions into our HPC management platform will provide sustainable and cutting-edge pathways for crypto-miners to unlock new levels of operational efficiency and profitability.” To benefit from this partnership, Hiveon customers simply need to agree to participate—Enersponse does all the legwork. This convenient, integrated power reduction solution saves energy and money while stabilizing the grid and reducing greenhouse gas emissions in the crypto sector. To enroll or learn more, visit: www.enersponse.com and https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fhiveon.com%2Fenterprise%2F&esheet=54095860&newsitemid=20240718216855&lan=en-US&anchor=https%3A%2F%2Fhiveon.com%2Fenterprise%2F&index=4&md5=a3080a33c535cae89c5fac6087825f8b. About Enersponse: https://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.enersponse.com&esheet=54095860&newsitemid=20240718216855&lan=en-US&anchor=Enersponse&index=5&md5=e19c29a49699ac5f6b68151a73b6e946 is an energy resource management platform that works with power providers across the country to aggregate their distributed energy resource (DER) and rebate programs with clients across the U.S. to maximize financial incentives by automating load reduction responses. This process helps providers maintain a stable grid; saves customers money; earns them passive income through rebates from utilities; and helps achieve corporate social responsibility objectives. The company’s intelligent automation-powered distributed energy resource platform is connected to hundreds of power generators across North America, all dispatchable to customers’ existing control systems. Enersponse’s advanced technology keeps track of what’s happening down to a micro-locational level—even for large enterprises with facilities distributed across multiple power grid providers— by monitoring weather patterns, system outages and energy pricing fluctuations. It then syncs the data collected with pre-set client preferences to intelligently adjust power use in real-time without the need for human intervention. This means less stress on internal resources and an automated one-stop-shop solution for consolidating all available energy conservation programs to maximize cost savings—ultimately paying customers and their control companies to save power. About Hiveon Enterprise Hiveon Enterprise is a profit-focused HPC management platform designed for enterprise-scale mining companies. It offers a suite of solutions to enhance operational efficiency and maximize profits, including a comprehensive data platform, AI insights, energy programs and advanced technical support. author: David Owens
title: President of the Football Association of Wales resigns
text:
Stephen Williams (Credit: FAW) The President of the Football Association of Wales, Stephen Williams, has resigned.
The governing body of Welsh football has not revealed the reason why he has left.
The Football Association of Wales said last month that Mr Williams, 60, had been suspended while an investigation was carried out.
On Thursday the association said: “After further discussions, Mr Stephen Williams has decided to resign from all of his roles within the Welsh Football Association.
“The Welsh Football Association recognises the hard work and support given by Mr Stephen Williams as a football supporter and President to Welsh football and its development, within Wales and on the international stage over the 37 last years.”
Mr Williams was elected president of the football association in 2021.
Football Association of Wales (Pic by Nik Mesney/FAW) As part of his duties as president of the Football Association of Wales, Mr Williams was responsible for overseeing football at all levels in Wales, and was one of those who made the decision to sack Rob Page as manager of the men’s team.
Last year, the FAW announced that it had severed all ties with one of their former presidents, Phil Pritchard, following disciplinary action.
An investigation at the time had concluded that he had made ‘misogynistic’ comments that discriminated on the basis of gender at a dinner before a match while he was a member of the council.

Key mechanism governing bone marrow stem cells opens door to new therapies
A key mechanism controlling how bone marrow stem cells work has been revealed in a new study, shining a light on the principles of stem cell biology and opening the door to new therapeutic pathways.
Eric So, Professor and Chair in Leukaemia Biology in the Comprehensive Cancer Centre, and his lab identified two molecules that control when bone marrow stem cells rest and recover, and when they spring into action and replicate. The researchers subsequently discovered an enzyme that mediates the functions of these molecules. Since bone marrow stem cell transplantation has been the key treatment for a large array of blood cancers, their findings open the door to a new pathway for their future therapeutics.
The research is
published in the Blood Journal.
"Given the critical functions of stem cells in bone marrow transplant and cancer biology, identification of a new druggable pathway not only will help to better understand the stem cell biology but also facilitates the development of more effective therapeutics in the future," said So.
Life-long replenishment for the blood system is dependent on
hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs), a rare population of self-renewing stem cells that mainly live in bone marrow. HSCs are key, because when needed, they can turn into different blood cells, such as red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets.
HSCs have two statuses: inactive and active. When they are inactive, a status also known as quiescent, they are protected from environmental stressors and are able to rest, preventing exhaustion. However, inactive HSCs must become active again to replicate themselves to replenish the blood system in response to problems such as infection,
blood loss and other complications.
There is a sophisticated and delicate balance to keeping stem cells inactive and protected, but at the same time also allow them to respond to stress when needed and replicate themselves. This balance plays a key role for
bone marrow transplantation—a life-saving procedure for various devastating diseases such as cancer. Similarly, the balance is also critical for cancer stem cells that sustain the disease and cause relapse. It is therefore critical to understand this process in order to design better treatments.
In the study, Professor So and his team found that two important molecules, namely Hoxa9 and b-catenin, work closely together to safeguard both these features in controlling the inactive and active statuses of HSCs. The team learned that one molecule is able to compensate for the other when it is inactive, providing a resilient system to protect our blood production.
These findings already help researchers understand to a greater extent the key principles involved in stem cell biology. However, Professor So and his lab subsequently identified a
critical enzyme named PRMT1 which mediates the function of Hoxa9 and b-catenin. Doctors already possess the ability to modulate PRMT1 in clinics, which means that understanding this biological process could provide new avenues for the development of efficient stem cell therapeutics.
More information:
Jennifer Lynch et al, Hematopoietic stem cell quiescence and DNA replication dynamics maintained by the resilient β-catenin/Hoxa9/Prmt1 axis, Blood Journal (2024).
DOI: 10.1182/blood.2023022082

author: Olímpia Mairos
title: Fim de semana com chuva. Começa no Norte e deve estender-se a todo o país - Renascença
text:
03 jan, 2025 - 07:15 • [Olímpia Mairos](https://rr.sapo.pt/artigo/33803/olimpia-mairos)
O primeiro fim de semana do ano deve trazer chuva e uma pequena subida da temperatura, em especial da mínima.
De acordo com as previsões do Instituto Português do Mar e da Atmosfera (IPMA), esta sexta-feira o céu deve apresentar-se muito nublado ou encoberto na região Norte que deverá contar também com períodos de chuva, que poderá estender-se à região Centro.
O vento deverá ser fraco a moderado do quadrante sul, soprando por vezes forte nas terras altas das regiões Norte e Centro.
As previsões apontam ainda para a possibilidade de formação de neblina ou nevoeiro matinal no interior da região Sul, formação de geada em alguns locais do interior e subida de temperatura no Norte e Centro, e pequena subida da temperatura mínima, em especial no Nordeste Transmontano.
As temperaturas máximas vão oscilar entre os 8ºC, em Bragança e na Guarda, e os 18ºC, em Aveiro e Leiria, e as temperaturas mínimas entre os 0º C, na Guarda, e os 11ºC, em Coimbra.
Nos Açores, o grupo Central (ilhas Terceira, São Jorge, Pico, Graciosa e Faial) está sob aviso amarelo, devido à previsão de “precipitação pontualmente forte”, até às 8h00 desta sexta-feira, e o grupo Oriental (São Miguel e Santa Maria) até às 14h00 locais.
No sábado, as previsões da meteorologia apontam para períodos de chuva fraca no Minho e Douro Litoral, aumentando de frequência e intensidade a partir da tarde, e estendendo-se gradualmente às restantes regiões.
Para domingo, prevê-se céu muito nublado, com abertas a partir da tarde, gradualmente de Norte para Sul e períodos de chuva, por vezes forte, passando gradualmente a regime de aguaceiros a partir da tarde, que poderão ser ocasionalmente sob a forma de granizo no final do dia, e de neve nos pontos mais altos da serra da Estrela.
O IPMA aponta ainda para a possibilidade de ocorrência de trovoadas e pequena subida da temperatura mínima.
